wifindus

Class ConfigFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • wifindus.ConfigFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ConfigFile
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A ConfigFile is a collection of key/value pairs parsed from text files, one per line, with the KVP being delimited with a colon (:) or equals (=) symbol. Keys may contain the characters A-Z, a-z, 0-9, hyphens, periods and underscores, and are stored in a case-insensitive manner (i.e. there is no difference between "port" and "PORT"); Values can be anything non-blank (outer whitespace will be trimmed and string values will have the surrounding " or ' characters stripped).

    String values may be provided without surrounding quotes, but macro replacement will not be performed in this instance (e.g. "\n" will not be substituted with the '\n' character). Config files may include C++-style comments (//) that will be ignored by the parser.
    Author:
    Mark 'marzer' Gillard
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public void read(java.io.File file)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads a file using a Java.IO File object. Reading a file into the ConfigFile will not delete existing keys, so multiple files may be read to create one virtual configuration. Existing kvp's will only be overwritten if an existing key is found in subsequent files.
        Parameters:
        file - The File object representing the config file's path.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file path did not exist or was not a file.

      • read

        public void read(java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> files)
        Reads a list of Java.IO File objects. Reading a file into the ConfigFile will not delete existing keys, so multiple files may be read to create one virtual configuration. Existing kvp's will only be overwritten if an existing key is found in subsequent files.
        Parameters:
        files - The iterable list of file paths to load. Any that are not found or throw an exception will be skipped.

      • read

        public void read(java.lang.String resource)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads a file from an embedded resource. Reading a file into the ConfigFile will not delete existing keys, so multiple files may be read to create one virtual configuration. Existing kvp's will only be overwritten if an existing key is found in subsequent files.
        Parameters:
        resource - The name of the embedded resource from which to load the config.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the ClassLoader could not find the given file resource.

      • getInt

        public int getInt(java.lang.String key,
         int defaultValue)
        Gets an integer value from the ConfigFile.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to look up.
        defaultValue - The fallback value if the given key does not exist or did not contain a valid integer.
        Returns:
        The parsed value, or defaultValue if the key did not exist or the value could not be converted to an integer.

      • getBoolean

        public boolean getBoolean(java.lang.String key,
                 boolean defaultValue)
        Gets a boolean value from the ConfigFile.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to look up.
        defaultValue - The fallback value if the given key does not exist.
        Returns:
        The parsed value, or defaultValue if the key did not exist or could not be evaluated as a boolean. Since values are stored as strings, this function considers "true", "on", "yes" and "1" as TRUE values, and is not case-sensitive.

      • getBoolean

        public boolean getBoolean(java.lang.String key)
        Gets a boolean value from the ConfigFile.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to look up.
        Returns:
        The parsed value, or FALSE if the key did not exist or could not be evaluated as a boolean. Since values are stored as strings, this function considers "true", "on", "yes" and "1" as TRUE values, and is not case-sensitive.

      • getString

        Gets a string value from the ConfigFile.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to look up.
        defaultValue - The fallback value if the given key does not exist.
        Returns:
        The value, or defaultValue if the key did not exist.

        Gets a string value from the ConfigFile.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to look up.
        Returns:
        The value, or "" if the key did not exist.

      • defaultInt

        public ConfigFile defaultInt(java.lang.String key,
                    int defaultValue,
                    int min,
                    int max)
        Ensures a key is a valid value 'by default' by checking the stored value exists, is of the correct type, and is within an acceptable range. If any of these conditions fails, a default value is applied.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to search for.
        defaultValue - The value to assign at the given key by default.
        min - The minimum acceptable value.
        max - The maximum acceptable value.
        Returns:
        The calling ConfigFile object, so you may chain operations.

      • defaultInt

        public ConfigFile defaultInt(java.lang.String key,
                    int defaultValue)
        Ensures a key is a valid value 'by default' by checking the stored value exists and is of the correct type. If any of these conditions fails, a default value is applied.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to search for.
        defaultValue - The value to assign at the given key by default.
        Returns:
        The calling ConfigFile object, so you may chain operations.
